articles.headline: A Big Bet That China’s Currency Will Devalue Further
articles.snippet: Investors like Mark L. Hart III are making a high-stakes gamble that China’s currency devaluation last month was not a one-time event.
articles.abstract: Investors like Mark L. Hart III are making a high-stakes gamble that China’s currency devaluation last month was not a one-time event.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Mark L. Hart III, a hedge fund investor based in Texas, makes an investment bet, he does it in the style of his home state: big time.

articles.headline: Military Analyst Again Raises Red Flags on Progress in Iraq
articles.snippet: In some ways, the Iraq team’s latest criticism mirrors the disputes of a decade ago, when the Bush administration, over many analysts’ objections, advocated a small force in Iraq.
articles.abstract: In some ways, the Iraq team’s latest criticism mirrors the disputes of a decade ago, when the Bush administration, over many analysts’ objections, advocated a small force in Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the war in Iraq deteriorated, a senior American intelligence analyst went public in 2005 and criticized President George W. Bush’s administration for pushing “amateurish and unrealistic” plans for the invasion two years before.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: A Car Scandal Shoves Berlin Off High Ground
articles.snippet: Germany, known as obedient to rules, finds its identity shaken as its claim to moral leadership of Europe has been tarnished after repeatedly urging other nations to welcome migrants.
articles.abstract: Germany, known as obedient to rules, finds its identity shaken as its claim to moral leadership of Europe has been tarnished after repeatedly urging other nations to welcome migrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — As Germany has emerged as the dominant actor in Europe, it has lectured Greece and other debtor nations on the virtues of thrift and lately wagged its finger at countries that balk at receiving a share of refugees from the killing fields of Syria. Its right to lead, based on a narrative of self-sacrifice and obedience to rules, was generally acknowledged.

articles.headline: As Europe Wrangles Over Migrant Relocation, Reality Moves Faster
articles.snippet: The situation on the ground is often very different from what is discussed in the conference rooms of Brussels as the tide of desperate people keeps flowing into Europe.
articles.abstract: The situation on the ground is often very different from what is discussed in the conference rooms of Brussels as the tide of desperate people keeps flowing into Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: PIRAEUS, Greece — Amid the rancorous bickering this week by European leaders over a relocation plan to spread asylum seekers around the Continent, a Coast Guard officer stood on the dock here at Greece’s main port screaming a blunt command at a throng of rain-soaked new arrivals: Hurry up and relocate yourselves.

articles.headline: Hajj Stampede Near Mecca Leaves Over 700 Dead
articles.snippet: The disaster, in which more than 850 were also injured, occurred on the first day of Eid al-Adha, one of the holiest days in the Muslim calendar.
articles.abstract: The disaster, in which more than 850 were also injured, occurred on the first day of Eid al-Adha, one of the holiest days in the Muslim calendar.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — In streaming ribbons of white, great masses of Muslim pilgrims made their way between cities of air-conditioned tents toward the next stop on their holy tour of Mecca in Saudi Arabia.

articles.headline: China to Announce Cap-and-Trade Program to Limit Emissions
articles.snippet: China will announce a landmark commitment on Friday to limit and put a price on greenhouse gas emissions, a substantial step by the world’s largest polluter.
articles.abstract: China will announce a landmark commitment on Friday to limit and put a price on greenhouse gas emissions, a substantial step by the world’s largest polluter.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Xi Jinping of China will make a landmark commitment on Friday to start a national program in 2017 that will limit and put a price on greenhouse gas emissions, Obama administration officials said Thursday.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Coral Davenport

articles.headline: After Volkswagen Revelation, Auto Emissions Tests Come Under Global Scrutiny
articles.snippet: Questions are increasing about the wisdom of allowing carmakers to have so much influence on how air pollution standards are enforced.
articles.abstract: Questions are increasing about the wisdom of allowing carmakers to have so much influence on how air pollution standards are enforced.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the United States, automakers conduct their own emissions tests and submit the results to the government. In Europe, automakers pick who conducts the tests and where they are done. And these two regulatory systems are considered the world’s gold standards.
articles.byline: By Danny Hakim and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: Pope Francis, in Congress, Pleads for Unity on World’s Woes
articles.snippet: Speaking to lawmakers on Thursday, the pope issued a call to action on issues largely favored by liberals, including a critique of the excesses of capitalism and a defense of immigration.
articles.abstract: Speaking to lawmakers on Thursday, the pope issued a call to action on issues largely favored by liberals, including a critique of the excesses of capitalism and a defense of immigration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Pope Francis, the spiritual leader of 1.2 billion Catholics, challenged Congress and by extension the mightiest nation in the world on Thursday to break out of its cycle of paralysis and use its power to heal the “open wounds” of a planet torn by hatred, greed, poverty and pollution.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Jim Yardley
